r.s: Provides an api to create a HTML tree
r.d: PHP Based api creates a tree structure using a couple of small PHP classes. This can then be converted to javascript using the printMenu() method. The tree is dynamic in IE 4 or higher, NN6/Mozilla and Opera 7, and maintains state (the collapsed/expanded status of the branches) by using cookies. Other browsers display the tree fully expanded. Each node can have an optional link and icon. New API in 1.1 with many changes (see CVS for changelog) and new features, of which most came from Chip Chapin (http://www.chipchapin.com).
r.n: QA release Bug #17696 Patch in order to allow minimization of JS code Bug #7324 Problem using together with XMLRPC Bug #13665 phpcs errors Request #14941 Improve PHPCS results (javascript, tabs vs spaces) Bug #15292 Unit test failure -Fatal error: Call to undefined method Tree::setup() Request #15957 images dont "work" on dark(er) backgrounds Doc Bug #16718 sample simple example fails
